text.p: The luxury liner Queen Elizabeth 2 collided with a 15-tonne whale during a cruise from Spain to Portugal, its captain said on Wednesday.
"It is sad and the passengers were concerned, although you couldn't say anyone was distressed. It is one of those things, like running over a cat," Captain Keith Stanley told reporters.

The 60-foot (18-metre) whale was seen pinned against the bow by the force of the tide as the 70,000-tonne Cunard liner entered Lisbon harbour on Sunday after leaving Cadiz. Rescue workers found it was dead when they removed it.
Stanley said whales normally evaded ships and suggested the mammal may have been dead or ill when it was struck. "I have been at sea for 40 years and never come across anything like it before."
